name: Mushroom Curry with Galangal
description: This is a jungle curry recipe, meaning it is very rustic and easy to make. This does not even require you to make a curry paste. Just put all the ingredients in the coconut milk and cook. This version is vegetarian; chicken can be added if you like.
recipeIngredient: 1 (2 inch) piece galangal, peeled and sliced

recipeInstructions.text: Put the coconut milk and galangal in a pot and bring to a boil. Add the kaffir lime leaves and salt; simmer for 10 minutes. Add the mushrooms and cook until soft, 5 to 7 minutes. Remove from heat. Stir the lime juice and fish sauce into the mixture; pour into a bowl and top with the Thai chilies to serve.

review.reviewBody: OMG!!!! Can I begin to tell you how amazing this is! The only thing I changed was that I added boneless diced pork at the five minute mark of the ten minute simmer with the kaffir lime leaves (i.e. five minutes coconut milk and lime; the next five minutes add the pork). I only did this to make it a little heartier but TRUST ME even as written this is an amazing dish with an incredible balance. Do do DO try to get galangal and not ginger. So many people treat them as interchangeable but trust me they're not. You will know the difference because galangal is smoother on the surface and has almost "tiger stripes" on it (google a picture of it you'll see what I mean). And YES if you can find them spring for the bag of kaffir lime leaves. They keep forever in the freezer and are well worth the investment for the difference they make in flavour to using just lime juice. I served it over jasmine rice and my life changed for the better forever. Thanks for the great recipe Wiley!
I needed a vegetarian version, so I substituted 1T Miso for the fish sauce and added cubed ex firm tofu.  I swear the sauce is so good I caught my picky 12 year old trying to lick the pot!

I had galangal on hand directly from Thailand but it was like a hard bark that wouldn’t slice so I just threw that in there and then I had some powdered as well and threw a pinch in there. Overall it was delicious I was afraid to use the fish sauce that I had purchased since it was thick and not the clear type but I couldn’t even taste it so it turned out great, the whole dish. The only thing I would change is to add a little bit of either flour or corn starch to make it Slightly thicker since it was pretty runny so it would stick to the rice better... I added a pinch of saffron in the rice as well, overall it was delicious!
Love Love Love!!!! I added chicken thigh with the leaves and salt. Also a tsp red curry paste instead of peppers because I didn t have any. So good!!!!!
